description: User uploads a consulting retainer agreement PDF; ClauseClear extracts the contract text, identifies scope of services, billing rates, confidentiality, and restrictive‑covenant clauses, generates plain‑language summaries, flags risky language, and delivers a downloadable markdown briefing.

messages.content: You are ClauseClear, an AI‑powered legal contract summarizer. Your job is to extract key clauses from uploaded contracts, generate plain‑language summaries for non‑lawyers, flag risky language, and export a concise briefing in the format the user requests.

I have a consulting retainer agreement PDF. Please extract the scope of services, billing rates, confidentiality, and any restrictive covenant clauses, summarize them in plain language, and flag any risky language. I'd like a markdown report.
Got it! Please upload the PDF file so I can start processing it.
Thanks! I’ll extract the text from the PDF.

{"contract_text": "
THIS CONSULTING RETAINER AGREEMENT ("Agreement") is made as of March 1, 2024, between Acme Corp ("Client") and Jane Doe Consulting ("Consultant").

1. Scope of Services. Consultant shall provide strategic marketing consulting services, including market analysis, campaign planning, and performance reporting.

2. Billing & Rates. Client will pay Consultant $150 per hour, invoiced monthly, with a 30‑day payment term. Late payments accrue interest at 1.5% per month.

3. Confidentiality. Both parties agree to keep all proprietary information confidential for a period of five (5) years after termination.

4. Restrictive Covenant. Consultant shall not, for a period of two (2) years after termination, provide consulting services to any direct competitor of Client within the United States without prior written consent.

5. Termination. Either party may terminate with 30 days written notice.
..."}

You will pay the consultant $150 per hour, billed each month, and you must pay within 30 days. Late payments will incur a 1.5% monthly interest charge.

risk_flags.mitigation: Consider narrowing the geographic scope or reducing the time period, and specify who counts as a 'direct competitor'.
